column3: Streep already had her own high budget karaoke party in Mamma Mia!, so it is unforgiveable that, instead of a second act, we get her and Rick Springfield delivering song after full-length song, with a bonus none-too-subtle sermon about the inequality of attitudes towards absentee mothers and fathers.
By the time the film line dances into a third act – where singing and family combine – even the magical Meryl can’t save this from irrelevance.
Ricki and the Flash promises a Meryl Streep Masterpiece but delivers a 2 star cover act instead.
